result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert G. Wintlend Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct-Boisterous Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $1392.32 paid directly to the Clerk of Court's Office prior to sentencing.  The 10% surcharge in the amount of $139.23 still due and owing - same repayment conditions apply as noted below for the Costs.

Attorney fees previously posted in the amount of $500 have been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 11:43 a.m. Defendant Robert G. Wintlend in court with attorney Chelsie A. Thuecks.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Thuecks. Statement by DE. Court orders: Restitution in the amount of $1392.32 - previously paid in full, Atty fees w/ 60 DTP or PP, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA sample and surcharge. Appeal rights given. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.
Sentencing hearing on October 11, 2016 at 11:45 am.

10:36 am case called. Defendant Robert G. Wintlend in court with attorney Chelsie A. Thuecks.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over hearing on calendar for this morning. Personal appearance waived by defendant. Court accepts waiver of personal appearance.  Agreement reached and read into record. State will move to amend Count 1 to Disorderly Conduct in violation of 947.01(1). Count 2 will be DRI.   Defendant advised of permissible punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts amendment of the State. Plea: No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea, enters JOC and adjourns sentencing to afford the defendant the opportunity to pay restitution in the amount of $1,392.32. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2016 at 11:45 am.
From Attorney Thuecks confirming resolution reached and matter set for hearing on 9/2/16.
Plea hearing on September 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Case called @ 2:27 p.m. Defendant Robert G. Wintlend in court with attorney Chelsie A. Thuecks.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Standard motions filed by the parties. Atty Thuecks has no objections to the States standard motions in limine. The Court addresses the State's Motion to Impeach with Prior Convictions. Statement by Atty Thuecks - feels that prior convictions are stale. Statement by ADA Anderson. The Court finds it appropriate that in the event that the defendant were to testify that he would be impeached as to all the prior convictions listed in the motion. No other motions to be addressed as all are standard.

Prior: 418 Point Basse Ave, Nekoosa, WI 54457

Jury trial on September 8, 2016 at 08:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Chelsie A. Thuecks in court appears telephonically.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Thuecks requesting a jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 10, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 8, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Status conference on July 5, 2016 at 02:35 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Chelsie A. Thuecks in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Thuecks requests additional status.  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 02:35 pm.
Status conference on May 31, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on May 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.  Defendant is not to serve in any fiduciary capacity.

Case Called @ 1:55 PM: Defendant Robert G. Wintlend in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel and states he has no funds to hire his own attorney.  Currently not working with assets discussed.  Def referred to SPD for eligibility.  Court would appoint counsel upon the payment of a deposit of $250 with a $50 per mo PP to commence 6/1/2016.  NGP entered by Court.   ADA argues as to Signature Bond w/conditions.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.
